subject: Hacktoberfest - a week away
header: Two weeks ago, I mentioned in the editorial about twin events i.e. Hacktoberfest and London Perl Werkshop. It is nearly a week away before the Hacktoberfest kicks in. Team at Perl.com has been preparing for it rigorously. They have even created an issue #203 to discuss the subject. However you could take a look list of issues for the ideas for Hacktoberfest challenge.

London Perl Workshop has started process of confirming talks. If you are planning to attend then why not add to your personal schedule your favourite talks. This would help the organisers in scheduling the talks accordingly. If you have never given talk before and would like to give your first talk then please submit your proposal as soon as possible. The last date for submitting proposal is 30th September 2019.
Good luck for Hacktoberfest challenge and see you at the next London Perl Workshop 2019 event.

entries.title: Come to the London Perl Workshop, write better code!
entries.text: LPW organisers started confirming talks. In the first series, they are talking about some of the talks that got confirmed.

chapters.title: Perl Weekly Challenge
chapters.header: The Perl Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Anwar will help you step out from your comfort-zone. You can even win the prize money of $50 Amazon voucher by participating in the weekly challenge. The weekly prize is kindly sponsored by Peter Sergeant of PerlCareers.

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Don't miss the fun and try new challenges every week. For more information, please read FAQ page.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge - 027

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Review of last week challenge. There are plenty of great solutions.

entries.text: Adam, ex-Champion, came up with his unique blog. You can't afford to miss it.

entries.text: Roger solution for Stones and Jewels task using just map{}. For mean angles task he used pure perl.

chapters.title: Perl Tutorial
chapters.header: A section for newbies and for people who need some refreshing of their Perl knowledge. If you have questions or suggestions about the articles, let me know and I'll try to make the necessary changes. The included articles are from the Perl Maven Tutorial and are part of the Perl Maven eBook.
